comment.body:
Class names on Pixiv are a nightmare, but I *think* I got this entry to work:
```
!#if !env_mobile
pixiv.net#?#main + aside:last-of-type > *:has(iframe[width][height])
!#endif
```

Not reproduced it on my end.

If that doesn't work, you should re-enable the content blockers in Safari settings (wait about the same time as when you update the filters).

issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] This site DOES NOT contain sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [X] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

AdGuard for Windows

### AdGuard version

7.15 (4386)

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Website or app doesn't work properly

### Which browser(s) do you use?

Chrome, Microsoft Edge

### Which device do you use?

Desktop

### Where is the problem encountered?

https://www.staples.ca/

### Ad Blocking

AdGuard Base filter, AdGuard Mobile Ads filter

### Privacy

AdGuard URL Tracking filter, AdGuard Tracking Protection filter

### Social Widgets

AdGuard Social Media filter

### Annoyances

AdGuard Annoyances filter, Adblock Warning Removal List

### Security

_No response_

### Other

Filter unblocking search ads and self-promotion

### DNS filters

_No response_

### Language-specific

AdGuard French filter

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

Hide your search queries, Send Do-Not-Track signals, Self-destruction of third-party cookies, Disable cache for third-party requests, Block third-party Authorization header, Block WebRTC, Block Location API, Hide Referrer from third-parties (specify in comment below, if used custom value), Remove X-Client-Data header from HTTP requests, Protect from DPI

### Add your comment and screenshots

It’s impossible to load the websites when “Block the third-party Authorization header” is enabled.

The same issue occurs on the following websites (all the same business):
bureauengros.ca
bureauengros.com
staples.ca

Here is the rule I use to fix it:
`@@*$stealth=3p-auth,domain=bureauengros.ca|bureauengros.com|staples.ca`

### Privacy

- [X] I agree to follow this condition

comment.body: Fixed, update should be available in 2-3 hours.

Hide your search queries, Send Do-Not-Track signals, Self-destruction of third-party cookies, Disable cache for third-party requests, Block third-party Authorization header, Block WebRTC, Block Location API, Hide Referrer from third-parties (specify in comment below, if used custom value), Remove X-Client-Data header from HTTP requests, Protect from DPI

comment.body:
Скорее всего защита не активна. 
Попробуйте очистить данные браузера, обновить фильтры (подождите около одной минуты), затем откройте сайт.
Если это не поможет, вам следует повторно включить блокировщики контента (веб расширения) в настройках Safari (подождите примерно столько же времени, сколько и при обновлении фильтров).
В противном случае обратитесь в support@adguard.com.

You have mistakes in the rules - they mustn't contain `||` in the domain. For instance, you can add the rule below to block the element or create your own by following [the article](https://adguard.com/kb/general/ad-filtering/create-own-filters/).

```adblock
economist.com##audio.react-audio-player
```

comment.body:
Not reproduced on my end - the websites open fine.
Try to clear browser data, update the filters (wait almost one minute there), open the site without third-party extensions.
If that doesn't work, you should re-enable the content blockers in Safari settings (wait about the same time as when you update the filters).
